Reviews.Content: Perfect Hotel This hotel was great. The location couldn't be better, walking distance from all the sites, and in Florence that's a super bonus. You can see the Duomo from the bedroom window! The hotel was clean, lots of towels and supplies, a fridge and the AC worked just fine. The staff is very friendly, and always willing to help. We have teenage children and they didn't have any complaints, for the amount of time you spend in your room it's not worth paying the price of a 5 star. We would surely return to this hotel in the the future.
Reviews.Author: Bartolillos

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Costatini I knew from the beginning that this was a simple and basic hotel, and that is accurate in every respect. However, we spend so little time in our room that paying for 4-star luxury would be a waste of money. If you expect luxury, then this is not for you. But if very clean, well-maintained, friendly staff/owners, and comfortable are high on your list, then Costantini serves very well. The bed was comfortable. I saw no threadbare linens as in earlier reviews. The bathroom was large and modern with a hairdryer and fluffy, plush terrycloth bath towels (a rarity in Italy at the 2 or 3 star category). And the location at any price cannot be beat--literally steps from the Duomo at the heart of Florence. Breakfast in their frescoed breakfast room was just enough, but nothing to get excited about (typical for Italy, though). FYI--I am a travel agent and I chose this for myself based on location and budget, but I would not hesitate to place clients here who know what to expect and don't need or want an Americanized experience.
Reviews.Author: buddyrdh

Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel in Florence! We spent 3 nights at this wonderful 2-star hotel in Florence, Italy. We stayed in one of the rooms in the back and it was great. The room was always clean, everything worked (including the A/C!) well and the staff was always attentive and responsive. Breakfast was included and there is free access to the internet on their single computer by the lobby. This hotel is across from the Duomo and close to all attractions in the city. We will *definitely* stay there during our next trip to Florence.
Reviews.Author: JulietteM

Reviews.Content: It's basic. Not romantic. Clean, safe, convenient The elevator does work-ust pull the little door open after you push the button and wait. Don't climb the stairs with 2 heavy bags like we did because it is more than 2 floors, technically speaking. When we first walked into our room, the simplicity took a bit of getting used to but overall we had a fine stay. I don't recommend the room for a honeymoon or romantic inspiration. The room is simple, not a picture on the wall but the room was clean. Our AC worked as long as we had the windows closed. This is the only hotel during our 12 day tour of Italy that had free internet on a new computer!!! Our bathroom had definitely been recently remodeled and it had a working hairdryer. We had a pretty painted ceiling. The bedding was a plain green bedspread. Everything worked. We had a cute view of the streets and the terrace below us. We felt safe. The staff understood most of what we said and they were helpful and kind. The breakfast is basic but has cereal, great yogurt, fresh coffee, some bread and juice. You really can't beat the location, close to it all. The price is great too. (It's less than the nasty Hotel Martelli (see my other review) .) Ponte Vecchio bridge is about a 10 minute walk to the right. Duomo is at your door. Straw markets are about 10-14 minute walk. Festival Gelato right near by. We told the morning man about how we thought the cab driver overcharged us and he was honestly upset for us  wanted to file a report and everything, very protective. Go to il Pizzauolo for the best pizza I've ever had in my life. Still want it. In summary, the hotel is basic. It's clean. It's simple, very simple but safe and we sure enough wished we were there instead of the rotten Hotel Martelli on our last night.
Reviews.Author: HonestlyNC

Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel in excellent location This hotel is barely a one-star. But location can't be better. It's 5 minute walk from everywhere in the historical city center. The hotel is very simple but clean, rooms are tiny and plain with no decor of any kind. In our room bathroom appliances were literally falling apart. Staff is friendly but most of them don't speak a word in English. Breakfest was as basic as it can get, definetely the worst we had comparing to many other 2* hotels around the Europe.
Reviews.Author: yg28

Reviews.Content: Friendly Staff This hotel was great. An incredible location, you walk outside and there is the Duomo. The staff was incredibly friendly and got to knowyou because you have to leave your key every time you leave. The air conditioning was not on so we had to open windows which was quite noisy. It was very clean. The hallway is quite noisy - we had a 2am wake up call with some noisy teenagers. The bathroom was roomy and clean. Great stay. We went for our Honeymoon in Feb.
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansBlk

Reviews.Content: Loved it My cousin and I stayed here and loved it. The location was wonderful and the staff was great. The elevator was an added delight--small but functioning--especially with all our luggage. The room was a very nice and accommodating size with a private bath. There was even a hairdryer that worked. Our stay was very pleasant and I would very much look forward to staying there again.
Reviews.Author: anonymousk

Reviews.Content: my home in florence I have found my home in Florence. This is a great little hotel for a single female traveller. It is located within 5 doors (give or take 1) of the Duomo on the street parrallel to via Roma. Could seen the roof of the Duomo from my room. Great bed, hot water, great breakfast but only drawback was that the bell tower gave me a wake up call at 7am each morning and since I had been travelling fairly extensively I was exhausted and just wanted to a have a sleep in. Very close to the Uffizi and also the Academia. Will definitely stay here again!!!
Reviews.Author: SydneyPetal

Reviews.Content: Best location in Florence The hotel is located maybe 100 feet from the Duomo. Our balcony had a drop-dead gorgeous view of the Duomo's facade. This hotel is in the middle of everything Florence has to offer; not more than a 15 minute walk from every attraction. I stayed in Florence a few years ago, near Piazza San Marino, which is about a 20 minute walk from the center and Duomo, and having stayed in the very center, I think it's a much better decision. You're in the middle of things; lots of people; tons of restaurants; a joyous atmosphere. The hotel is located in an 11th century building! The proprietor speaks fluent English. Nice breakfast -- coffee is brewed to order! We paid about Euro100 per night, which is a great deal.Con#1: very very loud, especially on Friday-Saturday nights. I keep the window open, and the noise from the outside (people, street cleaning, etc) was deafening. I had to wear ear plugs. For people who don't mind sleeping with the closed window, it's not that big of a problem.Con#2: the rooms are tiny. Basically, two people cannot pass each other. The bathroom was also very very small.Basically, a great deal for the money.
Reviews.Author: WhirlwindTravel

Reviews.Content: Noise was the only downfall       Entrance to Hotel Costantini
Reviews.Author: YankeeNC

Reviews.Content: Good hotel - Great location!! We stayed here two nights and were overall very pleased with our choice. The hotel was clean, large enough room and bath, and had a fantastic location - only 1/2 block from the Duomo. All the famous sights are within easy walking distance. Pros - reasonable price, spotless room, comfortable bed, elevator, very helpful staff spoke fair English, and, again, location. Cons - breakfast not great (but plenty of small cafes right outside door), no English-speaking TV programming (but then who is in Florence to watch TV?). We would stay here again and recommend the Costantini as a small, 3-star hotel with high marks.
Reviews.Author: Cancun-cutie

Reviews.Content: Not worth the view I booked this on verere, and thought the pictures were extremely deceiving. Although the location was great, the room was worn(bedspreads were about as thin as paper), dirty(the shower door didn't work and their was mold in the bathroom) and very noisy. We ended up staying at a great hotel down the same street for about $30.00 more a night.
Reviews.Author: rkonstanz

Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Although it's a bit of a haul with a suitcase from the train station, this hotel is almost next door to the Duomo, and down the street from the square and Uffizi. It is situated on one of the main tourist streets in Florence, and an easy wander to the markets. The fantastic location meant quite a bit of street noise, but it was a small price to pay. Euro-style breakfast was bread, juice and coffee. Big room, large bathroom. Helpful staff. Elevator. We booked on venere.
Reviews.Author: AussieGator
